Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Runnable
    The Game class is the JPanel where the user can interact and play the game.

    Version:
    Version 1.0 June 10th, 20120
    Author:
    Peng Chen, Branson Lee
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Window frame,
    int addScore)
        Allows the JPanel to listen for keyboard inputs and creates the proper Things that are needed in the game with backgrounds and sidebars.

        A button is in here with a ActionListener to pause the game anytime.

        Parameters:
        frame - A Window used to display this game.
        addScore - The increment of the score based on the user's selection of difficulty.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the Things that are created along with the game background. This method is inherited from JPanel.

        The if statement is so that if the user just went above the screen, the whole screen will be cleared first.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Inherited parameter of paintCoponent which will point to the Graphics class and draw Things.

      • removePlatforms

        public void removePlatforms()
        Removes all the Platforms on the screen.

      • addPlatforms

        public void addPlatforms()
        Add 3 Platforms on the screen with randomized Coordinates and colours. If the user's score increment is 10, the randomizing will only go through 6 colours. Anything above that, the randomizing will go through 12 colours. The next colour to be landed on is created here randomly. The while loops are to make sure no Platform overlap eachother and that they do not share the same colours.

        All added Platforms go in to the ArrayList of Platforms

        VARIABLE DICTIONARY:
        Variable | Type | Description
        theColourList | ArrayList | all the colours available
        rightColourIndex | int | the index of the Platform that will contain the next Color
        numColours | int | the highest index the colours will go up to in theColourList. Used to differenciate the Easy level with the rest.
        rightColour | int | the random selected index of the next colour in theColourList.
        other1 | int | the first other Platform that is not the one the user must land on.
        other2 | int | the second other Platform that is not the one the user must land on.
        colourIndex1 | int | the index of the Color that will be assigned to other1.
        colourIndex2 | int | the index of the Color that will be assigned to other2.
        yCoord | int | y location of the lowest Platform added.
        xCoord1 | int | first random x location of the first Platform.
        xCoord2 | int | second random x location of the second Platform.
        xCoord3 | int | third random x location of the third Platform.

      • badCollision

        public boolean badCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Thing> all)
        The method that checks if the Avatar and everything else in the Game are colliding.

        The first if statment suggests that if the Avatar has fallen to the ground/ the bottom of the screen, it's an automatic bad crash. If the user has the border Item however, they will start up top again without being game-over.

        The first forloop runs through EVERYTHING in the JPanel to see if anything is touching the avatar.

        The next for loops check for every Coordinate that the 2 specified Things touch. If the two Things do share the same Coordinate ever, true will be returned. If they do not, this method will return false.

        The indivisual if statments inside do last minute error-traps such as the user may only game-over when they hit the wrong platform going down and how hitting a Monster will result game-over unless the user obtained the shield. Of course, the inventory will reset itself / go back to null after use.

        Parameters:
        all - The ArrayList that contains every Thingg in this JPanel
        Returns:
        boolean If the collision is a bad collision, it will return true. If the collision is legal, it will return false.

      • getNextColour

        public java.awt.Color getNextColour()
        Gets the next colour that the user must land on.
        Returns:
        Color The next colour the user must land on.

      • colourMatch

        public boolean colourMatch(Platform pf)
        Method that checks if the Platform that the user landed on corresponds to the one that was asked for by the program.
        Parameters:
        pf - - the Platform that the user landed on
        Returns:
        boolean -if the User landed correctly, returns true

      • getColoursList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> getColoursList()

        VARIABLE DICTIONARY:
        Variable | Type | Description
        vanilla | Color | a vanilla colour
        brown | Color | a brown colour.
        c | ArrayList | a list of all the colours that a Platform may have

        Returns:
        ArrayList -Contains all the Colors that a Platform may have.

      • getAllThings

        public java.util.ArrayList<Thing> getAllThings()
        Method that stores and returns all the Things in this JPanel/Game.

        The for-each loops turns everything in p and i into Things and store them all indivisually in the t ArrayList.

        VARIABLE DICTIONARY:
        Variable | Type | Description
        t | ArrayList | a list of all the Things that this Game has excluding the Avatar.

        Returns:
        ArrayList a list of everything in the game.

      • keyTyped

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        A method that must be implemented because KeyListener was implemented. It checks for the user's keyboard entry and if it's either the left or right arrow key, it will move the Avatar either left or right. The JPanel shall be repainted to erase the Avatar's previous location.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        A method that must be implemented because KeyListener was implemented. It does not particularly do anything.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • run

        public void run()
        Inherited method from Runnable to run the animation. The repaint method is called to refresh the page so the animation works as intended.

        The while-loop is made so that if the Avatar jumped the first time, it will fall the 2nd time and repeat itself. During this level, a badCollision is called to make sure the Avatar did not hit anything that may cause game- over. If that should happen, the while loop will break. Also, the while loop will only work if the Avatar is above the bottom of the screen.

        The pause will work regardless of whether the Avatar is going up or down. The fact that it is assigned int values is because it is used to determine if the user later would want to exit or resume the game.

        VARIABLE DICATIONARY:
        Variable | Type | Description
        difficulty | String | represents which level the user is playing

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
        Method that will create a new Thread so it can run the implemented Runnable method run().

        VARIABLE DICTIONARY:
        th - Thread - points to Thread to make a new Thread class and calls start().
